CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 21, 1960, pg. A3, reads: "Key Role on U. S. S. Triton - John W. Wouldridge, radioman I/C, U. S. N., had a key role when the submarine Triton circumnavigated the globe in 84 days, submerged.  He was radio watch supervisor during the 'round-the-world jaunt, and was in constant contact with communications stations throughout the world.  He is shown above checking the high frequency transmitter aboard the Triton.  Radioman Wouldridge is the son of John H. Wouldridge of San Francisco, Calif.  His uncle and aunt, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Barber, reside at 831 Cherokee St., Pittsburgh."
TitMainTitle: John W. Wouldridge wearing headphones and seated behind communications equipment on USS Triton nuclear submarine
